name: Process ChIP-seq
title: ChIP-seq Analysis
short_description:
Align ChIP-seq data,
 filtering with BioBamBam and Peak Calling using MACS2. For full details about all parameters please consult the MACS2 documentation at https://github.com/taoliu/MACS

input_files.name: loc
input_files.help: path to a FASTQ sequence read file

input_files.name: bg_loc
input_files.help: path to a FASTQ sequence read file

input_files.name: genome
input_files.help: path to a assembly sequence file

input_files.name: index
input_files.help: path to matching BWA index file

arguments.name: macs_gsize_param
arguments.help: Mappable genome size

arguments.name: macs_tsize_param
arguments.help: Size of sequencing tags

arguments.name: macs_bw_param
arguments.help: Band width for scanning the genome when model building

arguments.name: macs_qvalue_param
arguments.help: Minimum FDR cutoff for calling significant regions

arguments.name: macs_pvalue_param
arguments.help: p-value cutoff

arguments.name: macs_mfold_param
arguments.help: Region to select within an m-fold range of high-confidence enrichment ratio against the background for model building

arguments.name: macs_nolambda_param
arguments.help: Use background lambda instead of local

arguments.name: macs_slocal_param
arguments.help: Small local regions

arguments.name: macs_llocal_param
arguments.help: Large local regions

arguments.name: macs_fix-bimodal_param
arguments.help: Turn on auto paired model process

arguments.name: macs_nomodel_param
arguments.help: Negate building shifting models

arguments.name: macs_extsize_param
arguments.help: Used with nomodel to expand read size to fixed-size fragments

arguments.name: macs_shift_param
arguments.help: When using nomodel this value is used to adjust the cutting ends before applying the extsize

arguments.name: macs_keep-dups_param
arguments.help: Controls for counting of duplicate tags

arguments.name: macs_broad_param
arguments.help: Control the placing highly eriched regions into a broad region with loose cutoffs

arguments.name: macs_broad-cutoff_param
arguments.help:
Cutoff for broad region,
 requires macs_keep-dups_param to be set

arguments.name: macs_to-large_param
arguments.help: Scale up small datasets

arguments.name: macs_down-sample_param
arguments.help: Random sampling to to downsize the dataset

arguments.name: macs_bdg_param
arguments.help: Store the fragment pileup and scores in bedGraph files

arguments.name: macs_call-summits_param
arguments.help: Reanalyse the shape of the profile to deconvolve subpeaks

name: NAFlex analyses
short_description: Set of analyses to extract Nucleic Acids flexibility properties from Molecular Dynamics trajectories

owner.author:

 González Carlos,
 Gelpí Josep Lluís,
 Orozco Modesto

input_files.help: Input nucleic acid (or protein-na complex) topology used in the MD simulation

input_files.name: crd
input_files.help: Input nucleic acid (or protein-na complex) trajectory obtained from a MD simulation

name:
TADbit map,
 parse and filter
title:
TADbit Hi-C mapping,
 parsing mapped reads and filtering of artifactual reads
short_description:
TADbit Hi-C mapping,
 parsing mapped reads and filtering of artifactual reads.

input_files.name: read1
input_files.help: from paired-end sequencing. This FASTQ should contain only one of the ends

input_files.name: read2
input_files.help: from paired-end sequencing. This FASTQ should contain only one of the ends

input_files.name: ref_genome
input_files.help: Reference genome.

input_files.name: ref_genome_gem
input_files.help:
Reference genome,
 indexed with gem-indexer,
 on which reads will be mapped.

arguments.name: mapping:rest_enzyme
arguments.help: For fragment-based mapping. Name of the restriction enzyme used to do the Hi-C experiment

arguments.name: mapping:iterative_mapping
arguments.help: Use iterative mapping instead of fragment-based mapping

arguments.name: mapping:windows
arguments.help:
For iterative mapping,
 or to refine fragment-based mapping. Should be like 1:20 1:25 1:30 1:35 1:40 1:45 1:50

arguments.name: parsing:chromosomes
arguments.help:
Only chromosome names to parse. Ex: chrX,
 1,
 2B,
 chrMito,
 Mito,
 chrXIV.

arguments.name: filtering:filters
arguments.help: Reference genome

arguments.name: filtering:min_dist_RE
arguments.help: Used to exclude reads starting too close from a RE site. Such reads are called pseudo-dangling-ends.

arguments.name: filtering:min_fragment_size
arguments.help: To exclude small genomic RE fragments (smaller than sequenced reads)

arguments.name: filtering:max_fragment_size
arguments.help: To exclude large genomic RE fragments (probably resulting from gaps in the reference genome)

meta_data.description:
TADbit mapping,
 parsing and filtering statistics

name: TADbit model
title: TADbit Hi-C 3D modeling
short_description: TADbit 3D modeling.

input_files.name: hic_contacts_matrix_norm
input_files.help: path to a tab-separated normalized contact matrix

arguments.name: resolution
arguments.help: Resolution of the normalization.

arguments.name: gen_pos_chrom_name
arguments.help: Chromosome name (chromosome name i.e. chr1)

arguments.name: gen_pos_begin
arguments.help: Genomic coordinate from which to start modeling.

arguments.name: gen_pos_end
arguments.help: Genomic coordinate where to end modeling.

arguments.name: optimization:num_mod_comp
arguments.help: Number of models to compute for each optimization step.

arguments.name: optimization:num_mod_keep
arguments.help:
Number of models to keep from the total of models computed,
 for the comparison with original Hi-C matrix.

arguments.name: optimization:max_dist
arguments.help:
Range of numbers for optimal maxdist parameter,
 i.e. 400:1000:100; or just a single number e.g. 800; or a list of numbers e.g. 400 600 800 1000.

arguments.name: optimization:upper_bound
arguments.description: Upper bound for Z-scored frequencies of interaction.
arguments.help:
Range of numbers for optimal upfreq parameter,
 i.e. 0:1.2:0.3; or just a single number e.g. 0.8; or a list of numbers e.g. 0.1 0.3 0.5 0.9.

arguments.name: optimization:lower_bound
arguments.description: Lower bound for Z-scored frequencies of interaction.
arguments.help:
Range of numbers for optimal low parameter,
 i.e. -1.2:0:0.3; or just a single number e.g. -0.8; or a list of numbers e.g. -0.1 -0.3 -0.5 -0.9.

arguments.name: optimization:cutoff
arguments.description: Cutoff distance to consider an interaction between 2 particles.
arguments.help: Range of numbers for optimal cutoff distance. Cutoff is computed based on the resolution. This cutoff distance is calculated taking as reference the diameter of a modeled particle in the 3D model. i.e. 1.5:2.5:0.5; or just a single number e.g. 2; or a list of numbers e.g. 2 2.5.

arguments.name: generation:num_mod_comp
arguments.help: Number of models to compute for each optimization step.

arguments.name: generation:num_mod_keep
arguments.help:
Number of models to keep from the total of models computed,
 for the comparison with original Hi-C matrix.

arguments.name: generation:max_dist
arguments.help:
Range of numbers for optimal maxdist parameter,
 i.e. 400:1000:100; or just a single number e.g. 800; or a list of numbers e.g. 400 600 800 1000.

arguments.name: generation:upper_bound
arguments.description: Upper bound for Z-scored frequencies of interaction.
arguments.help:
Range of numbers for optimal upfreq parameter,
 i.e. 0:1.2:0.3; or just a single number e.g. 0.8; or a list of numbers e.g. 0.1 0.3 0.5 0.9.

arguments.name: generation:lower_bound
arguments.description: Lower bound for Z-scored frequencies of interaction.
arguments.help:
Range of numbers for optimal low parameter,
 i.e. -1.2:0:0.3; or just a single number e.g. -0.8; or a list of numbers e.g. -0.1 -0.3 -0.5 -0.9.

arguments.name: generation:cutoff
arguments.description: Cutoff distance to consider an interaction between 2 particles.
arguments.help: Range of numbers for optimal cutoff distance. Cutoff is computed based on the resolution. This cutoff distance is calculated taking as reference the diameter of a modeled particle in the 3D model. i.e. 1.5:2.5:0.5; or just a single number e.g. 2; or a list of numbers e.g. 2 2.5.

meta_data.description: TADbit modeling statistics and result files

arguments.help:
Size of each nucleosome,

name: Chromatin Dynamics
title: Chromatin Dynamics
short_description: With the Chromatin Dynamics tool you can create your own 'beads-on-a-string' representation of a chromatin fiber.

input_files.name: sequence
input_files.help: DNA linker sequence

input_files.name: nuclPos
input_files.help: Put in position where the nucleosomes are positioned in the linker sequence. Between each number has to be a space: for example '5 15' creates a structure where one nucleosome is put after the 5th bp of the linker sequence and another one after the 15th bp of the linker sequence generating a linker of 10bp between the two nucleosomes. Before the first and after the last nucleosome there have to at least 5 base pairs. Between two nucleosomes there has to be at least 3 base pairs.

input_files.name: gffNucleaR
input_files.description: Create a 3D structure from nucleaR output
input_files.help: Create a 3D structure from an 'NR_' gff file from Nucleosome Dynamics

arguments.name: operations
arguments.help: Type of model to be created. Select the operation you want to execute

arguments.name: createTrajectory:numStruct
arguments.help: Number of structures to generate (max 100)

arguments.name: create3DfromNucleaR:genRegion
arguments.help: Obtain a structure from nucleosome positions within a genomic region calculated by nucleaR (within Nucleosome Dynamics). Use for example 'chrI:37415..39104'.

name: DNAShapeScan
short_description_: Predict binding sites for a protein on a given genome segment by using DNAShape to include information on the shape of DNA.
title: IN PROGRESS

owner.institution:
University of Southern California,
 University of Nottingham
owner.author:
Remo Rohs,
 Marco Pasi

input_files.name: binding_data
input_files.description: Experimental data describing the sequence specificity of the protein
input_files.help: The tab-separated plain-text file must contain on each line a sequence and the corresponding (relative) binding affinity score.

input_files.name: target
input_files.description: Genomic segment on which to predict binding sites for the target protein
input_files.help: Binding sites of the target protein will be predicted on the specified segment of the genome.

arguments.name: kmer1
arguments.description: Encode sequence information using a first-order feature
arguments.help:
Sequence information is encoded using a first-order feature,
 where each position along the DNA sequence is treated independently.

arguments.name: shape
arguments.help:
Features that encode the shape of DNA (such as Minor Groove width,
 Roll,
 Propeller twist and Helical twist) are used to improve the quality of the binding site prediction.

arguments.name: max_results
arguments.description: Limit the number of identified top-scoring binding sites that are returned
arguments.help: The specified number of top-scoring results will be included in the output.

arguments.name: dimer
arguments.description: Dimer mode: predict binding of dimers of the protein given a fixed spacing and a relative orientation of the binding sites
arguments.help:
Identify binding sites for a homodimer of the target protein; the relative orientation between the two proteins must be specified,
 as well as the spacing between the binding sites.

arguments.name: dimer:orientation
arguments.description: The relative orientation of the binding sites: forward or backward
arguments.help:
In order to identify binding sites for a homodimer of the target protein,
 the relative orientation of the two binding sites must be specified: 'forward' indicates the binding sites are in the same orientation; 'backward' indicates they are in reverse (palindromic) orientation.

arguments.name: dimer:spacing
arguments.description:
The fixed spacing between the binding sites,
 measured in base pairs
arguments.help:
In order to identify binding sites for a homodimer of the target protein,
 the spacing between the two binding sites must be specified.

meta_data.description: Binding sites of the target protein identified on the specified genome segment.

name: MD Energy Refinement
title: Structure Energy Refinement using Atomistic Molecular Dynamics
short_description: Molecular Dynamics workflow to energetically minimize a structure. MD Setup + 100ps free MD. Output last structure from the 100ps.

owner.author:
Andrio Pau,
 Hospital Adam,
 Gelpí Josp Lluis

input_files.name: pdb
input_files.help: Input PDB structure to be energetically refined

name: 3DConsensus
short_description: Analyse a protein-DNA complex 3D structure to identify interactions and study their impact on specific binding by integrating experimental data on the protein's DNA specificity.
title: 3DConsensus

input_files.name: structure
input_files.description: 3D structure of the protein-DNA complex in PDB format
input_files.help: The 3D structure of a protein-DNA complex in PDB format will be used to analyse the molecular determinants of specific binding.

input_files.name: binding_data
input_files.description: Experimental data describing the sequence specificity of the protein
input_files.help: The tab-separated plain-text file must contain on each line a sequence and the corresponding (relative) binding affinity score.

arguments.name: chains
arguments.description: Commma-separated list of chains to be analysed from the PDB
arguments.help:
Specify which chains from the PDB file will be analysed; typically the first three chains (A,
 B and C) indicate the protein and the two strands of DNA.

meta_data.description: The processed PDB file used for visualisation.
Detailed output of tool for custom visualisation.
